content.question:
Two separate studies aimed to explore the link between adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) and later-life health and social outcomes. The study participants completed a questionnaire on various ACEs, such as abuse and household dysfunction. The data from the two separate studies are depicted in the graph.

Percent of ACEs reported in Two Separate Studies*

*Original ACE Study had 17,337 participants. 69.9% reported experiencing at least one ACE. Expanded ACE Study had 1,784 participants. 83.2% reported experiencing at least one ACE.

What was the impact of including community-level stressors in the expanded ACE study?

choices.label: It decreased the prevalence of individuals who reported having at least one ACE.
It decreased the prevalence of individuals who reported having 4+ ACEs.
It decreased the prevalence of individuals who reported 0 ACEs.
The inclusion of community-level stressors in the expanded study had no impact on the reporting of ACEs.

content.answer: It decreased the prevalence of individuals who reported 0 ACEs.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
